meanings.definition: A person or group that competes with another.
meanings.sent1: In the race, my corrival was right beside me the whole time.
meanings.sent2: The two companies were corrivals in the market, always trying to outdo each other.
meanings.sent3: At the spelling bee, my corrival misspelled the same word as me, making us both laugh.
meanings.sent4: The corrival team in the championship match fought fiercely, like two rival lions in the jungle.
meanings.sent5: My corrival in the chess tournament was a formidable opponent, always keeping me on my toes.

meanings.definition: To compete with someone or something.
meanings.sent1: I will corrival against my friend in the upcoming tennis match.
meanings.sent2: She corrivals with her classmates to get the highest grades in the class.
meanings.sent3: The siblings corrival playfully to see who can finish their chores first.
meanings.sent4: The two artists corrival for the spotlight, each trying to outshine the other with their paintings.
meanings.sent5: Students corrival in the science fair to showcase their innovative projects.
